column1: Which of the following glands is purely serous?
column8: The parotid gland is the only major salivary gland that is purely serous. Submandibular is mixed, sublingual predominantly mucous.

column1: Which of the following statements regarding cardiomyocytes is NOT correct?
column2: They have a better developed endoplasmic reticulum than rhabdomyocytes
column3: Their mitochondria occupy a larger portion of their cell mass than in rhabdomyocytes
column4: They have a greater supply of glycogen than rhabdomyocytes
column5: They have a less developed endoplasmic reticulum than rhabdomyocytes
column8: Cardiomyocytes have a less developed sarcoplasmic reticulum than skeletal muscle and rely on extracellular Ca²⁺.

column1: Which one of the following cells is NOT part of the reticular connective tissue located in the red bone marrow?
column8: Mesangial cells are kidney glomerular cells, not part of bone marrow.

column1: From which embryonic layer originates the smooth muscle tissue?
column8: Smooth muscle originates from mesenchyme derived mainly from mesoderm.

column1: Macrophages in the tissues are derived from which of the following blood cells?
column8: Tissue macrophages differentiate from circulating monocytes.

column1: Which glial cell participates in myelin formation in the PNS?
column8: Schwann cells form myelin in the peripheral nervous system.

column1: All of the following statements regarding hematoxylin & eosin stain are true EXCEPT:
column2: Hematoxylin is a basic stain, eosin is an acidic stain
column4: The basophilic structures are red in color
column8: Basophilic structures stain blue, not red.

column1: Which cytoskeleton is associated with the hemidesmosome?
column8: Hemidesmosomes anchor keratin intermediate filaments to the basal lamina.

column1: A genetic defect in the motor protein DYNEIN is linked to which disorder?
column8: Dynein defect causes immotile cilia syndrome (Kartagener).

column1: Which cytoskeleton is associated with the adherent (adherens) junction?
column8: Adherens junctions connect actin filaments via cadherins and catenins.

column1: Plasmalemmal proteins originate from which organelle?
column8: Plasma membrane proteins are synthesized on RER-bound ribosomes.

column1: Caveolae are involved in all of the following EXCEPT:
column8: ATP synthesis occurs in mitochondria, not caveolae.

column1: The second meiotic division during oogenesis begins:
column8: Meiosis II starts at ovulation and arrests at metaphase II.

column1: How long after ejaculation is the maximum fertile time for most sperm?
column8: Maximum fertility occurs after capacitation (~4 hours).

column1: What is the name of the outer layer of the blastocyst?
column8: The trophoblast forms the outer layer and contributes to placenta.

column1: Which zona pellucida protein acts as a receptor for sperm binding?
column8: ZP3 mediates sperm binding and acrosome reaction.

column1: In which cavity are exocoelomic cysts localized during the second week?
column8: Exocoelomic cysts float in the extraembryonic (chorionic) cavity.

column1: Approximately how long after fertilization occurs the first cleavage of the zygote?
column8: First cleavage occurs about 30 hours post-fertilization.

column1: The amniotic cavity is formed by cells of the:
column8: Amnioblasts derived from epiblast form the amniotic cavity.

column1: Identify the indicated structures (TEM image).
column8: Concentric dense lamellae around an axon indicate myelin.

column1: Identify the indicated cells (cerebellum image).
column8: Purkinje cells are large, flask-shaped neurons in a single row.

column1: Identify the indicated cells (white matter image).
column8: Fibrous astrocytes are star-shaped glial cells in white matter.

column1: Identify the indicated structures (skeletal muscle TEM).
column8: Triad consists of a T-tubule and two terminal cisternae at the A–I junction.

column1: Identify the indicated layer (skin histology).
column8: Dark granular layer with keratohyalin granules is stratum granulosum.
